By  Michelle HarrisDecember  

Three republicans have announced their interest in being the state representative for the seventy-sixth district PERIOD

In order to be on the primary election ballot Mar PERIOD  candidates must file an economic disclosure statement statement of candidacy and a nominating petition of  registered voters signatures with the State Board of Elections between Monday and Dec PERIOD  PERIOD

Brad Burzynski  of Sycamore is an alumnus of Illinois Wesleyan University PERIOD He is the governmental affairs director for the DeKalb County Farm Bureau a 6500member organization dedicated to improving the profitability of farming PERIOD

Burzynski said his job involves tracking the local impact of state and federal legislation by monitoring county and township governments boards of education and divisions of road repair PERIOD

Burzynski said he believes education funding is very important PERIOD Education is funded primarily through property taxes he said PERIOD In most areas enough tax revenue is generated by industry to pay the bulk of educational costs but in this district most of the land is agricultural PERIOD So its the farmer who gets hit PERIOD

Charles Marshall  of Somonauk is an alumnus of University of Illinois and Illinois Institute of Technology PERIOD He has practiced law for  years in Somonauk PERIOD He has acted as States Attorney and Assistant States Attorney for DeKalb County and Special Assistant States Attorney for LaSalle County PERIOD He has also been a member of the DeKalb County Board for  years PERIOD

This broad experience in all levels of government here I feel has equipped me extensively to serve this district knowledgeably and effectively he said PERIOD

John Felver  of DeKalb is the NIU associate director of housing PERIOD He was a delegate to the  National Republican Convention he been the DeKalb County republican party chairman for eight years vice chairman of the Republican County Chairmans Association and precinct committeeman for  years PERIOD

Felver has been on the legislative committee for Dekalb County Farm Bureau educating farmers on legislative issues since  PERIOD At NIU he was the faculty adviser for the College Republicans for eight years and helped found the Residence Hall Association PERIOD He is currently the Evans Scholars adviser PERIOD

Felver said he is qualified because he has worked in all spheres of local concerngovernmental NIU student agriculatural and social issues. advertisement
